H0.text: Disease prevention is the result of abnormal cell division.

H1.text: Tissue repair may result from abnormal cell division.

H2.text: Metamorphosis is a possible result of abnormal cell division.

H3.text: Cancer can result from abnormal cell division.

A4.text: A well-known example of this is the Philadelphia chromosome, or translocation of chromosomes 9 and 22, which occurs in chronic myelogenous leukemia and results in production of the BCR-abl fusion protein, an oncogenic tyrosine kinase.

A5.text: The transformation of a normal cell into cancer is akin to a chain reaction caused by initial errors, which compound into more severe errors, each progressively allowing the cell to escape more controls that limit normal tissue growth.
